title: NanoID for R
text: ai/nanoid tiny, secure, URL-friendly, unique string ID generator JavaScript. nanoidr package R port NanoID. original NanoID library generates random strings using crypto API, replaced openssl::rand_bytes nanoidr package. See also Generating Secure Random Numbers R details openssl::rand_bytes.

title: NanoID for R
code: ## Basic usage. nanoidr::nanoid() #> [1] "eCds8xPSGyf-u7AoAaOVW" ## You can use your own random number generator. nanoidr::nanoid(29, func = function(size) {   runif(size, 0, 255) }) #> [1] "TlLb2P0Hj5ehmBTnm3JnpDpy4W1MK"

title: NanoID for R
text: reside-ic/ids: ℹ️ Simple random identifiers sqids/sqids-r: Official R port Sqids. Generate short unique IDs numbers. stri_rand_strings: Generate Random Strings - R Package stringi random_strings: random_strings stringfish: Alt String Implementation

title: NanoID for R — nanoidr-package
text: R port NanoID tiny, secure, URL-friendly, unique string ID generator JavaScript. original NanoID library generates random strings using crypto API, replaced openssl::rand_bytes nanoidr package.

title: Predefined character sets — no_lookalikes
text: Return predefined character set ported 'nanoid-dictionary'. function supports 2 patterns; "nolookalikes" "nolookalikesSafe".
